events.name: WeConnect Official Launch
events.description:
Westermo is officially launching our WeConnect Cloud based VPN Service, you are invited to join us at IOT Asia 2018 happening on the 21st to 22nd March 2018 at the Singapore Expo Hall 3, Booth B21.
Simply RSVP for any of our 3 daily presentation sessions and come with the Eventbrite confirmation order, you will be able to walk away with complimentary Bluetooth speaker.
Date:  21st – 22nd March 2018
Time: 1100 hrs, 1400 hrs, 1600 hrs
Location: IOT Asia 2018, Singapore Expo Hall 3, Westermo Booth B21
Do note that you have to register yourself over at IOT Asia for free trade visitor pass to enter the exhibition area.
http://www.internetofthingsasia.com/registration  See you there
events.location: Singapore Expo Hall 3, 1 Expo Drive, Singapore 486150

events.name: Bcoin.sg - Guide to Cryptocurrency Ethereum, Smart Contracts & ICOs

Seats are limited. Sign up early to reserve your seats. Don’t forget to invite your friends and sign-up for the other seminars! https://www.eventbrite.sg/e/bcoin-intermediate-ethereum-smart-contracts-and-the-onset-of-icos-tickets-44177060778 --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- A series of crypto meetups that aims to provide a structured approach in building your knowledge and understanding in the cryptocurrency world. The key objective of these complimentary sessions is share knowledge about this seemingly complicated, technical crypto-land and lead the wider public towards guided and transparent knowledge, not just based on hear-say, before advancing into this space. • What to bring • Important to know

events.name: ICON Singapore Meet Up - Hosted by XSQ
events.description: ICON Foundation holds its first Singapore Meet Up where they will be bringing their dApps companies to share about the intricacies of building on the Icon Blockchain. Come and hear about the developments of Icon and some of the successful companies in Singapore that has conducted their ICOs. Event Schedule: 1830hrs - 1845hrsICON Foundation Presentation by Amy Jung 1845hrs - 1915hrsBluewhale dApp Presentation & Q&A by Will Lee, Co-founder of Bluewhale 1915hrs - 1930hrsTink dApp Presentation & Q&A by J.J Lee, Co-founder of Tink 1930hrs - 2000hrsPanel Discussion withKyber NetworksBluzelleICON FoundationHosted by Gwen Regina 2000hrs - 2015hrsSparrowExchange Presentation & Q&A 2015hrs-2030hrsNetworking About teams ICON ICON allows independent blockchains with different governance structures to transact with one another without intermediaries. Like other protocols, ICON too hopes to solve for scalability and speed however the stand-out premise of ICON is our ambition to solve the issue of interchain operability. Learn more on: https://icon.foundation Sentinel Protocol Sentinel Protocol is a Security Intelligence Platform for Blockchain (SIPB) to protect valuable crypto assets against hacking, scams and frauds. Sentinel Protocol leverages the blockchain technology to optimize system availability and integrity while also utilizes the consensus and incentive scheme to share collective security intelligence. Its decentralized Threat Reputation Database (TRDB) is provided on public blockchain for crypto exchanges, payments and wallet services so that the value of stolen currencies can be incapacitated. Sentinel Protocol operates based on collective intelligence of cybersecurity specialists, as well as preventive security measures such as machine learning for behavior modeling and cost-effective distributed sandboxing. Telegram Channel: https://t.me/uppsalafoundationTelegram Group: https://t.me/sentinelprotocolTwitter: https://twitter.com/s_protocolFacebook: https://www.facebook.com/sentinelprotocol/Reddit: https://www.reddit.com/r/Sentinel_Protocol/ Blue Whale Blue Whale Foundation has been established to build a decentralized ecosystem to allow self-employed and freelancers to reap rewards and employment benefits from their contribution. Website: https://www.bluewhale.foundation/Twitter: https://twitter.com/BlueWhaleFdn?lang=enFacebook : https://www.facebook.com/bluewhalefoundation/Medium: https://medium.com/blue-whale-foundationYoutube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCj6pXevvLiO7YHm0fOMvwhw?view_as=subscriberLinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/bwx/Telegram: https://t.me/bwxicobwxico Tink Personal background information is often asked when starting a new personal and business relationship. However, it takes more than background information to understand each other and establish a trust-based relationship. User profiles in social media today are not verified, which makes it difficult to establish trust-based relationships with profile information alone. Any good relationship is built on trust for each other but it costs too much time and effort to earn trust from others. Tink is a decentralized social platform that creates credible personal information through social verification and a complete profile with qualitative information of the user. Tink’s profile based network helps users to build a strong and trustworthy human network and opens new opportunities in relationships, employment, and finance. Website: www.tink.world Email: [masked]Telegram: https://goo.gl/LwY5YcMedium: https://medium.com/@tink.social XSQXSQ is a Singapore based blockchain and cryptocurrency investment and infrastructure firm. XSQ focuses in blockchain advocacy and investments in cryptocurrency and blockchain related activities and is heavily involved in community engagement. Website: www.xsq.ioTelegram: https://t.me/xsqcommunityFacebook: www.facebook.com/xsqsg
events.location: PayPal, 5 Temasek Blvd, #07-01 Suntec Tower Five, Singapore 038985

events.name: Xamarin For Beginners Part IV of IV: Introduction to Xamarin.Forms - Hands On
events.description: • What we'll doXamarin For Beginners Part IV of IV : Introduction to Xamarin.Forms This is the fourth and final Hands-on Session out of 4 that will cover the basics of Developing cross-platform applications with Xamarin aimed at a beginner audience. Knowledge of C# would help a bit. Xamarin.Forms let you define a single UI that you share across all your supported platforms. This maximizes your ability to share code: you can share your UI and your business logic. In this course, you will create a new Xamarin.Forms application and define your shared UI in code. You will also see how to access platform-specific features such as the phone dialer or camera that do not have a shared-programming model integrated into Xamarin.Forms. • SpeakersBen Ishiyama-Levy - Xamarin MVPPedro Costa – Xamarin ExpertUdara Alwis – Xamarin Expert • Pre RequisitesWindows: https://developer.xamarin.com/guides/android/getting_started/installation/windows/#installationhttps://developer.xamarin.com/guides/ios/getting_started/installation/windows/#installation • Source Code for exercices: https://github.com/XamarinUniversity/xam120/ • What to bringlaptop • Important to knowPizza at 18:30
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, Level 22, Room CF12, One Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018989

events.name: Atlassian User Group - March 2018
events.description: This 22nd of March 2018, we are hosting our 2nd AUG Signapore Meetup. Here is our Agenda: 7:00 pm Networking and FoodArrive, discuss about your favorite Jira hack over dinner prior to the session! 7:30 pm Welcome and Updates 7:40 pm One Click via Jira - Sathiyaseelan Murugaiayh 8:00 pm Openspace Propose, Vote, Participate in the discussions that you want 8:50 pm Swag Giveaway 9:00 pm Supper at Lau Pa Sat Important Note! Please RSVP @ https://aug.atlassian.com/events/details/atlassian-singapore-presents-atlassian-user-group-march-2018 as sponsorship of food is granted is accounted through this! Also, do register your attendance through this Meetup Event itself Hosted By Steve Teo, Marine Lacourie, Abe Adduru - Atlassian User Group Leaders What is Atlassian User Groups? For nearly a decade, Atlassian customers have come together to network, share ideas, solve problems, and find new ways to use Atlassian products. Today, more than 15,000 people take part in Atlassian user groups in more than 30 countries.

events.name: Big Companies & Pioneering Teams in VR/AR - An AsiaVR meetup with KPMG
events.description: Can you believe that nearly a quarter of 2018 is over?! It's about time we take a look at what's happening in VR & AR with some of the biggest companies and pioneering teams in the space. This meet-up is organised in partnership with KPMG. Our speakers: *Lyon Poh, Partner, Head of Digital + Innovation, KPMG Singapore*Topic: KPMG's Focus on Emerging TechLyon is a Partner within KPMG’s Advisory practice, specialising digital business, process transformation, cyber security, data and analytics, services.Lyon has over 19 years of professional experience in working with various government agencies and multi-national companies in Singapore. He is also the Chief Information Officer (CIO) for KPMG Singapore who is responsible for directing and managing the firm’s digital transformation initiatives.More recently, he founded Digital + Innovation practice in Singapore which includes the setup of KPMG Digital Village and more recently KPMG Lighthouse. KPMG Lighthouse aims to become a centre of excellence for Data and Analytics and Emerging Tech. *Joe McGinn, Producer, Google*Topic: Preparing for the Immersive Computing RevolutionJoe will give us an update on Google's VR & AR platforms and the future of computing.He recently joined Google Singapore as a Producer to support VR and AR developers in the region. Prior to joining Google, he was lead game designer at Radical Entertainment, Activision-Blizzard, the Walt Disney Corporation, and Ubisoft. He led the design of Radical's breakout hit The Simpsons: Hit & Run, listed on Metacritic as the highest-rated Simpsons game of all time. His 2007 game Crash of the Titans was nominated for "Best Children's Video Game" by the British Academy of Film and Television Arts (BAFTA). Joe also spent three years as Department Chair of Game Design & Production at DigiPen Singapore, where he created their first VR lab and VR game design courses. *Guannan Pu, Technology Evangelist, Engineer & Poet, Facebook*Topic: The Future of AR & VR with FacebookGuannan will share more on how you can create augmented reality experiences with Facebook Frame Studio & AR Studio through Facebook’s Camera Platform. As Product Partnership Manager APAC, Guannan works with strategic partners to build a thriving platform ecosystem fitted with the latest technology. He also spent his first few years in Facebook as an engineer. Prior to Facebook, Guannan was a senior engineer working on AAA games programming and colour grading for Hollywood movies. Guannan graduated with a Master of Engineering in Computer Engineering from Nanyang Technological University. He also majored in Mathematics at Tsinghua University. He clinched the top prize at the Singapore Tertiary Chinese Literature Awards.” *Adam Draper, Founder & Managing Director, Boost VC*Topic: A fireside chat hosted by Tee Jia Hen of VRCollabAdam is a 2x entrepreneur and a 4th generation venture capitalist. In 2009, the same year that Adam graduated from UCLA, he founded Xpert Financial, a secondary market for private securities. After settling millions of dollars in private security transactions and becoming a registered broker dealer, he left Xpert Financial in late 2012 and began angel investing, where he backed such startups as Coinbase, Plangrid and Amplitude. Adam then partnered up with Brayton Williams to change the face of global startup mentorship. The focus of Boost VC on future technology development stems from Adam Draper's dream to create an Iron Man suit. ** Announcements - This is a chance for you, our community members, to share (in 5 minutes or less), about any opportunities. Showcase & sharing - Our favourite part of the evening! Please bring anything you’d like to share with the community. Check out our public AsiaVR Company Directory (https://asiavrassociation.wordpress.com/2017/06/25/asiavr-company-directory/), for 360 video, VR and AR companies in the region!Sign up to be listed at this link: http://bit.ly/2sP7nxw See you soon!
events.location: KPMG Singapore , 3rd Floor, 16 Raffles Quay, Hong Leong Building , 048581
events.group_name: AsiaVR Association - Singapore Virtual Reality Meetup Group

events.name: March Prometheus Meetup
events.description: We are excited to announce that we have Matt Bostock, organiser of Prometheus London Meetup and the mastermind behind Prometheus at Cloudflare [1] visiting Singapore and he'll be giving a talk about Prometheus architecture at Cloudflare. Matt will explain some the design decisions made when deploying Prometheus to monitor Cloudflare's 135+ points of presence, followed by a Q&A session. The talk will cover: - How Prometheus is deployed at Cloudflare- Monitoring within failure domains- How Cloudflare routes and visualises alerts- Options for long-term metrics storage Next, Ankur Shrivastava will talk about monitoring and alerting at Carousell and how they use Prometheus and other tools in our production setting. Following Ankur, Binh Le will give an introduction to Cloudflare Workers and how you can use them to write and run a Prometheus Blackbox-exporter in the cloud. 1. https://promcon.io/2017-munich/talks/monitoring-cloudflares-planet-scale-edge-network-with-prometheus/
events.location: Cloudflare Singapore, 120 Robinson Road, #15-00 Justco Building, 068913

events.name: Artificial Intelligence with Real Impact
events.description: * PLEASE NOTE:This course will be taught in Python 3.0 + other high level AI programming framework. Attendees are expected to be able to program in Python and have a fair understanding of math and stats. This event is brought to you by UpCode Academy. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ There is a lot of FOMO driving AI in every sector now, and a lot of hype surrounding AI. Many startups have rebranded themselves into one that is “AI-driven”, and Chinese and American investors are pouring in huge amounts of money into the space. On top of that, FANG and BAT are extremely avid in seeking acquisitions (e.g. DeepMind, DNNResearch), as well as going on technology demonstration sprees. Most notably, we have:1. Google’s AlphaGo beating Ke Jie (the world’s top Go player)2. Baidu’s Xiaodu AI trumping humans in facial and voice recognition. Everyone wants in on a piece of the action and a slice of the AI pie. The main challenge is to work out what is fluff and what is truly achievable with state-of-the-art techniques. Unfortunately, there are many extravagant headlines and articles mongering fear, uncertainty and doubt (“FUD”) – mostly over AI replacing jobs. In this talk, the focus will be on discussing deep learning techniques using neural networks rather than AI in general or other machine learning techniques like SVM. This will lead us to a more accurate and precise understanding of the true impacts & applications of AI. The speaker, Tomithy, will share on the following:- What is AI & deep learning and how is it applied to different industries?- What is all the hype of AI about and why is it important to get your hands dirty?- How to get started with AI?- Demo: simple AI learning how to play a game from scratch About the speaker:Tomithy plays the role of the seeker & investor with ST Telemedia, which invest across Telcos, Data Centres and growth stage tech companies in the Artificial Intelligence/Big data, Cybersecurity and Cloud technology space. He actively evaluates these companies in terms of their technology and business strategy to sieve out the golden snitch from the noise. Tomithy is trained in computational biology and is self-taught for programming and artificial intelligence. He has a particular interest in applying evolutionary algorithm to neural networks, games playing AI and the stewardship and ethics of AI. Tomithy has more than 10 years of programming experience and has worked with various research groups including the Galaxy project, NUS-MBI, A*STAR (GIS, BII). He will share some key insights into AI and its application.
events.location: ACE Ideation Centre, Blk 79 Ayer Rajah Crescent #01-13 JTC LaunchPad@One-North, Singapore 139955

events.name: The Tech Revolution: Strategies to Navigate a New Era
events.description:
Technology is evolving at a rapid pace. Modern advances have transformed information into an invaluable asset. Our consumption patterns, digital behavior and our performance online is becoming a crucial aspect of decision making through all sectors. The challenge is to be prepared. There is a range of new technologies that are fusing the physical, digital and biological world, influencing all disciplines, economies, and industries. Technological breakthroughs such as artificial intelligence, Internet of Things, Quantum Computing and Data Science are reshaping our everyday life. The response must be integrated and comprehensive involving all stakeholders, from the public and private sectors to Academia and Civil Society. 
Your job will be affected directly by these trends and it is your responsibility to be prepared for the New Tech Revolution. In this session, you will learn which skills are needed to strive in an environment of constant innovation and how to leverage on AI, Quantum Computing, Cybersecurity, Robotics to create a professional edge.
events.location: The Assembly, The Working Capitol on Robinson, Singapore 068907

events.name: Cloud Training Day: BigQuery, Image Classification, Dataprep, Tensorflow
events.description: Join us for the ultimate cloud and machine learning workshop day at the FOSSASIA Summit. We are running a one day focus training on Friday, March 23 starting at 9.00am in cooperation with Google. For early arrivals we have some breakfast snacks ready. Topics covered are:* BigQuery* Data preparations for machine learning* Image classification* Text extraction from images SCHEDULE 9:00 AM Welcome Breakfast Snacks and Intro9:30 AM BigQuery codelab, Jan Peuker (https://www.linkedin.com/in/jan-peuker-2b14b169/)10:30 AM DataPrep, KC Ayyangari12:00 AM Lunch Break1:00 PM Extract, Analyze & translate Text from Images with Cloud ML APIs, Sara Robinson (https://www.linkedin.com/in/sara-robinson-40377924/)2:30 PM Coffee Break2:45 PM Image classification using Cloud ML, Kaz Sato (https://www.linkedin.com/in/kazunori279/)4:15 PM "Workshop ends (Participants receive a digital certificate of participation from FOSSASIA after the event) --More Talks/Workshops:4:30pm The myths and realities of serverless architecture, Owais Zahid5:00pm Hands on with Kubernetes Tutorial, Michael Bright6:00pm Sessions End WORKSHOP CONTENT You can access the workshop content on Qwiklabs. Please find info here: https://qwiklabs.com/focuses/9390 (account login required) SESSION DESCRIPTION * BigQuery Codelab, Jan PeukerA hands-on coding workshop with Google's interactive global scale data analysis tool BigQuery. * DataPrep,In this workshop we will explore how Cloud Dataprep can help you to make the most out of your data by automatically detecting schemas, datatypes, possible joins and anomalies such as missing values, outliers, and duplicates. Profiling your data can be time-consuming, Dataprep helps you to save that time and go right to the data analysis. You can plug your solution into Cloud Dataprep as it is serverless and works at any scale. * Extract, Analyze & translate Text from Images with Cloud ML APIs,This workshop will cover the topics: Vision + NLP + Translation APIs * Image classification using Cloud MLWe will explore examples of business that have adopted TensorFlow and Cloud ML to solve their real-world problems: a cucumber farmer in Japan who was able to build a deep learning-based cucumber sorter by himself, a used car auction service using Tensorflow for classifying car models and parts, and a food manufacturer that has been able to increase productivity significantly in their baby food factory. WHAT TO BRING Please bring your laptop. This is hands-on workshop. IMPORTANT For this workshop day you need a ticket for the FOSSASIA Summit. To get your ticket, please go to https://2018.fossasia.org/tickets/
events.location: Lifelong Learning Institute , 11 Eunos Road #08-03              Singapore 408601
